boardgame.name: Japanese Vehicles of the Second World War
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The dominant force in the Pacific in during the middle stages of the war, the Japanese military played a desperate gamble to knock out its American and European enemies before the full weight of their retaliation could be brought to bear. Spearheaded by sea and air power, the vehicles presented in this book were used on the islands of the Pacific as the war leapt from one to another. Though not facing the massive armoured conflicts of Europe and Africa, the vehicles the Japanese employed during the war were nevertheless interesting and varied.

This supplement for Traveller introduces many vehicles that formed the fighting arm of Japan in the Second World War, and provides full details of each, allowing them to be used within games. The weapons unique to Japan are also covered, along with enough information for you to use them in your own games and own vehicle designs.

Uses in Traveller

The vehicles found in this book could potentially form the basis of a campaign set in the Second World War. They may also be of interest to those who are simply curious as to how real-world vehicles can be implemented using the Traveller vehicle design system. However, we suspect many more players will want to actually use them in their games, even on planets far in the future and hundreds of light years away!

We have provided game mechanics for many vehicles, from the devastatingly agile Mitsubishi Zero, to the Type 95 tank but, at the end of the day, a Type 95 need not look like a Type 95 if it were built to these specifications on an alien world. It could end up looking very different but have the same characteristics listed in this book. By this token, what this book provides is a solid set of military vehicles available at Tech Level 5. A referee can use them to fully flesh out a military force on a Tech Level 5 world and provide interesting variations on themes in order to give his world more depth.

For example, a referee creating a military force for a new world may simply design a single main battle tank for it before moving on to the artillery piece, the fighter plane, and so on. With this book, he can present a military force that has a defined timeline with the development of its vehicles, so there is not just one main battle tank but several, each a replacement of the one before though with all still in service, with the very best units getting the latest generation of tank.

Players can have fun with this book as well, especially if they are engaging in paramilitary actions or running their own mercenary force. What this book will provide them is a list of Tech Level 5 vehicles that, while outmatched by more sophisticated enemies, will be perfectly serviceable (and at a cheaper price!) on more primitive worlds and will be capable of standing up against infantry from higher Tech Levels – at least, until plasma weaponry and missiles become prevalent.

Находка для шпиона

스파이폴
boardgame.description:
Spyfall is a party game unlike any other, one in which you get to be a spy and try to understand what's going on around you. It's really simple!

Spyfall is played over several rounds, and at the start of each round all players receive cards showing the same location — a casino, a traveling circus, a pirate ship, or even a space station — except that one player receives a card that says "Spy" instead of the location. Players then start asking each other questions — "Why are you dressed so strangely?" or "When was the last time we got a payday?" or anything else you can come up with — trying to guess who among them is the spy. The spy doesn't know where he is, so he has to listen carefully. When it's his time to answer, he'd better create a good story!

At any time during a round, one player may accuse another of being a spy. If all other players agree with the accusation, the round ends and the accused player has to reveal his identity. If the spy is uncovered, all other players score points. However, the spy can himself end a round by announcing that he understands what the secret location is; if his guess is correct, only the spy scores points.

After a few rounds of guessing, suspicion and bluffing, the game ends and whoever has scored the most points is victorious!

Dues for the Dead
boardgame.description:
From the Front Cover:

For years, the Most Solemn Order of the Silent Shroud has tended the dead at Valinghen graveyard, providing them a peaceful eternal rest. Now, that rest has been disturbed by a necromancer seeking out a key to re-activate the Pool of Radiance. An adventure for 1st-4th level characters.

From the Introduction:

Welcome to Dues for the Dead, a D&D Expeditions adventure, part of the official D&D Adventurers League organized play system and the Tyranny of Dragons storyline season.

This adventure is designed for three to seven 1st-4th level characters, and is optimized for five 2nd level characters. Characters outside this level range cannot participate in this adventure. Players with ineligible characters can create a new 1st-level character or use a pregenerated character.

The adventure takes place in Phlan, a large city on the shore of the Moonsea, in the Forgotten Realms. More specifically, it takes place almost entirely in and beneath the city's cemetery, Valhingen Graveyard.

Vampire Mafia
Мафия. Кровная месть
吸血鬼教父
boardgame.description:
Please welcome the re-invented classic: Vampire Mafia — the secret identity party game! Some might say that Vampire Mafia is inspired by Werewolf, but quite the opposite is true as Mafia first appeared in the USSR in 1986, then later emerged in the USA in a much softer form as Werewolf.

Vampire Mafia is the TRUE Russian mafia-like game, based on a few decades of player feedback. It includes the most interesting cards and scenario variants, extensive guide for the moderator. Be prepared for the challenge; see the game the way it is meant to be played!

Did we mention that Vampire Mafia inhabits a unique setting, one in which vampires are good guys who are ready to spill the blood of the vampire hunters, who are the forces of evil? Well, there it goes!

boardgame.name: DDEX1-6: The Scroll Thief
The Scroll Thief
boardgame.description:
From the Front Cover:

Scholars Square is a relatively quiet corner of Phlan, but a series of odd thefts have the headmasters of various school in the area concerned. The headmasters' pleas for help have gone unanswered by the Black Fist, and the Lord Sage of Phlan decides to reach out to you and your kind to bring those responsible to justice. An adventure for 1st-4th level characters.

From the Introduction:

Welcome to The Scroll Thief, a D&D Expeditions adventure, part of the official D&D Adventurers League organized play system and the Tyranny of Dragons storyline season.

This adventure is designed for three to seven 1st-4th level characters, and is optimized for five 2nd level characters. Characters outside this level range cannot participate in this adventure. Players with ineligible characters can create a new 1st-level character or use a pregenerated character.

The adventure is set in the city of Phlan in the Cracked Crown inn, but turns explores a number of different locations in Scholar's Square before plumbing the depths of the ruins beneath Mantor's Library and the sewers beneath Phlan.

boardgame.name: Moscow to Paris
Москва-Париж
boardgame.description:
You are invited to an exciting railway journey in Europe – from Moscow to Paris, from Rome to Berlin. Build your own routes, play wagon cards and watch your opponents!

Moscow to Paris is a quick and easy card game. Four city cards are revealed and placed for all to see. Then players try to match wagon cards played besides cities to wagon cards that they play in their own areas. There are also special cards and cities that bend the rules. You can even add your own city to the game!

A traveler that visited the most cities will win the game!

boardgame.name: Meazy N More!
boardgame.description:
Meazy N More! is essentially a game system, comprising 144 dice — 36 for each player, 6 each in 6 colors. You can play with two copies of the game to allow 5–8 players. An unusual feature of this game system is that there are core rules that all the games use. The core rules instruct players to roll their dice, form legal combinations for the game they're playing, then put their unused dice back in their "rolling bins", and pass them to the left. Each such round of veritable drafting is called a "shake". Shakes continue until someone wins the game.

Meazy N More! comes with rules for four games built upon those core rules:

In Eazy Meazy (30 minutes, ages 5+), you must build a "pyramid" of dice: 1×1 though 6×6; however, each "level" of one number must be a different color, and once a die is assigned to a level, that level's color is locked.
Not So Eazy Meazy (30 minutes, ages 5+) differs from Eazy Meazy by allowing the player to choose on the fly which number goes in each level; rearranging is completely legal.
Meazy Street (90 minutes, ages 8+) is the featured game (ages 8+). In addition to forming a pyramid, you must form a "straight" and a "rainbow", but these things must be done in a particular sequence. Unlike the previous two games, you calculate your score for the round based on the combinations you form.
Splitting Headache (90 minutes, ages 8+) is billed as a bonus game. In this game, you try to form the four different types of "splits", after which you may work to form the "banana split" out of the remaining dice. You calculate your score for the round based on the splits you formed by the time the round ended.


Further games for the system will be released as expansion packs and/or downloads from the publisher's website.

boardgame.name: Aonir Roolipeli
boardgame.description:
User summary:
Aonir is a fantasy RPG created and published by Teemu Suontaka in 2014 as part of his master's thesis on degree of business economics used as a case example of getting from idea to product. It is available for sale as PDF on the RPG's official website and a free preview PDF about the game is also available.

In Aonir a fantasy world is invaded by alien tzerads, which causes steampunk technology development and appearance of mutated, green skinned orc race. The magic in Aonir is mostly based on psionics and alchemy. The game uses mainly d6 and d12 dice and also d12+d6 which is written as d18. The rules system is Teemu's own design but the main inspirations are from D&D and Praedor. The book includes seven character classes from mystic to ranger, three playable races: humans, mutated orcs and alien tzerads and all together over 70 weapons, spells and magic potions. The art for Aonir is all found from rpgnow.com under free-to-use license.

Karty czarów - Wtajemniczenia
Spellbook Cards: Arcane
boardgame.description:
From the back cover:

Contains 257 durable, laminated cards for all Wizard, Warlock, and Sorcerer cantrips and spells from level 1 to 9. A perfect reference tool for spellcasters of every type.


Publisher blurb:

This deck of spell cards [is] an invaluable resource for any magic-user. Consult the entire deck when selecting new spells to learn, and after a long rest you can set aside those spells you want to prepare for the day. Each deck is made from thick laminated card so they will stand the test of time.


Spell name and important info is easy to find for quick reference.



Descriptive/Mechanical text is written in full wherever possible. When it isn't, a Player's Handbook page reference is given.



Scaling spells have an additional section with details on how they improve.



Card backs prominently display spell level for easy sorting.



The Spell cards are highly durable and are made to last. Each card has a coating that protects them and makes them safe to use with dry erase markers.



Contains 231 cards for all Wizard, Warlock and Sorcerer spells from level 1-9.

boardgame.name: Road to Heaven Board Game
boardgame.description:
Road to Heaven Board Game is a fun multi-sensory game created to bring families together & bring the Bible alive in the hearts of all ages and backgrounds thereby drawing them to God and on their own Road to Heaven. The Road to Heaven was developed to provide people of all ages and backgrounds the opportunity to experience and learn the Word of God as spoken through our Lord Jesus Christ and as written in the Bible while having fun through an interactive multi-sensory game.

Travel 157 spaces from worldliness all the way through the cross and end at Heaven’s Gates. But beware. Do you have what you need to get into Heaven? Along the streets paved with gold, players will learn how to live a true Christian life. Players will need to think strategically as they meet up with temptations and worldliness, a simple roll of the dice can determine your fate. Will you roll one die or two? Which piece or card will you decide to take? Encounter the forgiveness of the Lord and rejoice will the blessings showered upon you. The Holy Spirit is your guide, helper and companion throughout the game. As you play you will: Experience excitement to draw your family and friends together; Progress along the books of the Bible; Draw cards to test your Bible knowledge; Be reminded of strategies for addressing temptations in your life; Learn the difference between the wisdom of God and the foolishness of the world
Realize the importance of having the Holy Spirit as your companion and helper.

The Road to Heaven Board Game design and game pieces are biblically based and include 3 sets of playing cards (Bible Book Cards, Blessing Cards and Knowledge Cards) and the following CUSTOM plastic pieces: 13 Lambs Book of Life pieces, 6 Crosses, 7 Earths, 6 Earth Stands, 6 Tips and Reminder Cards and 12 playing tokens in the shape of the Ichthys symbol or "Jesus fish" which are typically used to proclaim an affiliation with or affinity for Christianity.

Road to Heaven Board Game comes with a full size bible and has original art work. Both the cards and plastic pieces are made of higher quality than is required and standard. A minimum price of $39.95 plus tax per game was suggested by the manufacturer (plus shipping). It is priced to sell.

Road to Heaven Board Game is a fun, family-oriented, Bible focused board game designed to be as competitive and engaging as it is spiritually enriching. It is a game that will bring families together while at the same time teach all ages the books of the Bible and the scripture inside. You learn about the Bible in the midst of the ups and downs of the action.There is nothing comparable on the market that can provide a platform to learn the Bible in such a fun and exciting way! What an opportunity to outreach and introduce Jesus to unbelievers in a non-threatening way. You never know what will happen next. We pray and know that this game will have a positive impact on your life and that you have a great time playing it again and again.

Road to Heaven is a wholesome Christian game that’s fun AND meaningful. Road to Heaven teaches you how to live your life for Christ. Learn how even good things come out of bad things that happen along the Road to Heaven. This teaches that challenges you go through become opportunities for you to help others grow.
